page.title: 08Woodcutting.
page.content: To the South East of Coombe Valley is the small business of a local woodcutter. This man has been cutting wood for 44 years. He makes furniture such as dining-tables, stools, dressers. He makes things to order. He gets his wood from St Blazes. He used some mahogany, which is expensive because of the disease that attacks the wood. He buys his screws in bulk from out of the county, as this is cheaper. His working hours vary. He has no assistants. He learned his trade working at Holmans, in Camborne, for 30 years, though he did not train as a carpenter. His amenities are adequate and he is very happy living and working in Cornwall.
